message: I open my eyes to a loud thudding.
Shooting up from the sofa, I see Mink stomping up the stairs.
With a rustle of wings, Mink's cockatoo lands atop the clock.

name: トリ
message: "There are bedrooms upstairs. You two should get some rest."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Good idea. Wait... was I asleep?"

name: トリ
message: "For about two or three hours. We checked out the town while you were sleeping."
Ren is curled up asleep at my feet.
As I pick him up, a question pops into my head.

name: 蒼葉
message: "By the way, what's your name?"

name: トリ
message: "What's it to you?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "No, like, this is Ren. What's your name?"

name: トリ
message: "I have no name."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Then what does Mink call you?"

name: トリ
message: "'Hey', 'you', 'bird', et cetera."
That does sound like him...
I give the bird a bit of a shrug, then carry the sleeping Ren upstairs.
Just off the stairs on the second floor is another open space. It has a billiard table and darts and a bar.
Further in, there's a hall with several doors on each side. Those must be the bedrooms the bird mentioned.
Mink's large frame is sprawled out on the couch in front of the TV, his arms behind his head.
I stop just as I pass behind him.
Something's been weighing on my mind for a while now. This seems as good a time as any to ask.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Hey, so."
No response. But I know he can hear me.

name: 蒼葉
message: "What are you planning to do here?"
Mink looks at me without saying a word.

name: 蒼葉
message: "You need my power for something, right?"
"Then don't I have a right to know what it is?"
I'm sure Mink understands what I'm asking, but he just turns his eyes to the ceiling.
As the silence starts to become unbearable, he mutters, almost too low to hear―

name: ミンク
message: "...I'm after Toue."

name: ミンク
message: "I want to destroy him. That's why I'm here."
Though it surprises me to hear him say it, somehow, I had a feeling that's what Mink was after.
But...

name: 蒼葉
message: "Why do you want to destroy him?"
Is it some kind of personal grudge? Or does he just not like Toue for some reason?
I look at the man lying there on the couch. Something tells me it isn't so simple.

name: ミンク
message: "You don't need to know."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hey!"
Mink abruptly rises to his feet.
Without another word, without even looking at me, he marches down the hall and vanishes into one of the bedrooms.
...What the hell?
I sit down on the couch Mink just vacated.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...I don't get him at all."
I sigh.

name: 蒼葉
message: "You never have any idea what he's thinking. Right, Ren?"
I start up Ren in my lap, looking for some sympathy.

name: 蓮
message: "'Right' what exactly?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "I mean him, Mink. Why he's like that."

name: 蓮
message: "I imagine that's just his personality."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Well, yeah, but..."
This whole situation has me feeling pretty conflicted.
Mink brought me here so he could use my power.
But I really don't want to use my power if I can avoid it.
At the same time, Mink helped me save Granny.
If he hadn't been there, I might never have found her.
He kept up his end of the bargain. I have to keep up mine.
That's why I want to know exactly what he's after and why he wants to use my power.
But I can't get anywhere if he thinks I "don't need to know."
Am I just supposed to follow him around without asking any questions and use my power when he gives the order?
That would make me a literal tool...

name: 蒼葉
message: "I just can't see this going well..."

name: 蓮
message: "You'll just have to find a solution to your problem. Don't worry, you'll figure something out."

name: 蒼葉
message: "You really think so?"

name: 蓮
message: "I was just repeating what you say when you find yourself in a difficult position."

name: 蒼葉
message: "That's not funny..."
I pinch Ren's smug little nose.
I'm so glad he's here with me.
Just being able to talk to him like this is a welcome distraction. If I were here alone, I might have just made a run for it.
At this point, I tell myself, there's no choice but to see it through.
I stand up with Ren in my arms.
I enter one of the rooms―not the one Mink is in―down the hall, set Ren on the bed, and lie down next to him.
I just took a nap on the couch downstairs, but drowsiness overcomes me the moment my body hits the bed.
The more I think about Mink, the more worried I am about what's to come.
But worrying isn't going to change anything.
There are some people you'll just never get along with no matter how hard you try...
I should try to get some rest today and give it another shot tomorrow...
I stare up at the ceiling, worries cycling through my head, until sleep finally takes me.
